intro: Conanthera urceolata, commonly known as the bladderpod, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its distinctive pod-like seed capsules. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and produces small, white or pale pink flowers. Its leaves are trifoliate, consisting of three leaflets, and it has a short, sprawling growth habit. The seed pods are inflated and resemble small bladders, giving the plant its common name.
